sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Mirth for citizens. Or, a comedy for the country Shewing a young farmer his unfortunate marriage, his wife is so churlish & currish in carriage he married her for beauty, for's own delight now he repents it both day and night. By physiognomy adviseth young men that at: to be sure to look before that they leap, to leap at a venture, & catch a fall, raising the forehead break horns and all. Tune of, Ragged, torn, and true. Miles, Abraham.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts)
Printed for P. Brooksby at the Golden Ball in Py-corner, [London] : [1673?]
Signed: Abraham Miles. Place and date of publication from Wing. Verse - "Hey boys my fathers dead,". Imperfect; trimmed at head affecting title. Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
=======
